folder: Westchester Avenue & Wheeler Avenue, Bronx, NY
text:
Westchester Avenue (foreground), north side, from Wheeler Avenue (right) to Bronx River Avenue, showing part 3 of a panoramic view of the large Watson estate when north-and-south-bound thoroughfares were being cut through the property. Viewing from right to left can be seen the beds of Evergreen and Colgate Avenues. Shown, too, are the tracks of the New Haven Railroad and the sloping area lying on the right bank of the Bronx River. Many two-story brick dwellings were later constructed in this area.

About 1910

folder: Westchester Avenue & Wheeler Avenue, Bronx, NY
text:
Westchester Avenue (foreground), north side, from Wheeler Avenue (right) to Bronx River Avenue, showing part 3 of a panoramic view of the extensive Watson estate at the time public thoroughfares were being cut through the property. Viewing from right to left are the beds of Evergreen, Colgate, Close, and Bronx River Avenues. In the background lies the sloping West Farms area of the borough, on the right bank of the Brox River. This is mount 3B and shows the same area as mount 3A, taken several months later.

About 1910
